GBSeq_references.GBReference_title: Genetic Adaptations of an Island Pit-Viper to a Unique Sedentary Life with Extreme Seasonal Food Availability

GBSeq_references.GBReference_journal: Submitted (07-AUG-2019) Herpetology, Chengdu Institute of Biology, CAS, Number 9, Seciton 4, Ren-min Nan Road, Chengdu Institute of Biology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Chengdu, Sichuan 610041, China

GBSeq_comment: Trinity, developed at the Broad Institute and the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, represents a novel method for the efficient and robust de novo reconstruction of transcriptomes from RNA-seq data. Trinity combines three independent software modules: Inchworm, Chrysalis, and Butterfly, applied sequentially to process large volumes of RNA-seq reads. Trinity partitions the sequence data into many individual de Bruijn graphs, each representing the transcriptional complexity at a given gene or locus, and then processes each graph independently to extract full-length splicing isoforms and to tease apart transcripts derived from paralogous genes.; ##Assembly-Data-START## ; Assembly Method :: Trinity MAY-2015 ; Sequencing Technology :: Illumina HiSeq ; ##Assembly-Data-END##

GBFeature_quals.GBQualifier_value: pooled brain, liver, heart, skeletal muscle, and gonad tissues
